articles.content:
Foreign Guests Here 
    Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- Foreign delegations and guests arrived here Saturday to participate in the meeting dedicated to the great persons of Mt. Paektu and an international meeting for supporting the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea to be held on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the liberation of Korea.
 Among them are Marwan Sudah, chairman of the Arab Committee for Solidarity with the Korean People and Supporting to the Reunification of Korea, and his party, a delegation of the France-Korea Friendship Association led by Secretary General Henri Boudin, Noboru Kameda, representative of the Society of Japan-Korea Culture, Takashi Nata, representative of the Japan Ehime Institute for Modern Korean Studies and British singer Suzannah Clarke and her party.    
 Arriving here earlier were Zhou Wei, daughter of Zhou Baozhong who was related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, and her party.

articles.content:
Japan's Move to Grab Tok Islet Protested 
    Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- The south Korean military authorities on August 3 strongly protested against the move of Japan to grab Tok Islet, south Korean CBS reported.
 Recalling that Japan wrote in the "defense white paper" that Tok Islet belongs to the territory of Japan and defined it as a disputed area, the military authorities termed this a grave move to grab Tok Islet.    
 Such move of Japan is intolerable, they noted, demanding the Japanese government delete all the references to the islet from the "defense white paper".

articles.title: Japan's Plan for Huge Group Visit to "Yasukuni Shrine" under Fire
articles.content:
Japan's Plan for Huge Group Visit to "Yasukuni Shrine" under Fire 
    Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Lawmakers belonging to the "National Assemblymen's League for Proper Education in History" held a press conference on August 3 at which they issued a statement denouncing Japan's plan for a huge group visit to the "Yasukuni Shrine", south Korean MBC reported.
 Accusing the ultra-rightist organization of Japan of planning to arrange a visit to the shrine by 200,000 persons on August 15, they in the statement declared that they would conduct a campaign for checking it.    
 They decided to convey a press statement opposing the visit to the shrine to the Japanese government and bring a suit against the ultra-rightist organization of Japan.

Meeting Held to Hear Stories from Innovators in Period of Great Chollima Surge
articles.content:
Meeting Held to Hear Stories from Innovators in Period of Great Chollima Surge
    Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- A meeting was held at the Central Youth Hall here on Thursday and Friday to hear real stories under the title "Let's leave beautiful traces of life in the way of working hard for the prosperity of the country".
 Labor innovators in the period of the great Chollima surge after the war took the floor. 
 Labor Hero Ho Kum Son, worker of the Pyongyang Textile Mill, recalled with deep emotion her days in her twenties. She stimulated her work teammates ideologically to bring about collective innovations. As a result, the work team carried out its yearly plan at 320 percent in a matter of six months, thus winning the title of the Chollima workteam in Juche 48 (1959) and that of twice Chollima workteam next year.
 Kim Ju Gyo of the Kim Jong Thae Electric Locomotive Factory played a main role in manufacturing the nation's first electric locomotive "Pulgungi 1" and had the honor of receiving Kim Il Sung Order in the subsequent period. He spoke with pride of the heroic drive waged by its workers to produce the first electric locomotive in hearty response to the instructions given by President Kim Il Sung during his field guidance given to the then West Pyongyang Railway Factory in August, Juche 48 (1959). At that time the President encouraged them to display the spirit of self-reliance, telling them to be bold enough to try to manufacture an electric locomotive on their own.    
 Labor Hero Ri Sin Ja, advisor to the Pyongyang City Rural Economy Management Committee, said that an ordinary country girl, she became a "red agitator" known to the whole country and an official later. She earnestly called upon all the agricultural workers to bring about a great boost in the production and construction and a rich harvest this year without fail, by remaining true to the Songun revolutionary leadership of Kim Jong Il with the same spirit and stamina as displayed in the period of the great Chollima surge.

articles.title: National Peasant Dance Contest of Agricultural Workers Held
articles.content:
National Peasant Dance Contest of Agricultural Workers Held
    Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- A peasant dance contest of agricultural workers selected from across the country was held at the foot of Moran Hill in Pyongyang Friday in the run-up to the 60th anniversary of the liberation of Korea.
 Peasant dancers from Yongok-ri of Taedong County, Chujong-ri of Paechon County, the Nammin Cooperative Farm of Sinuiju City and Chungsang-ri of Chosan County were highly appreciated at the contest. They successfully represented the fruitful work of the agricultural workers through dance pieces rich in ideological content and high in artistry. Their harmonious and refined presentations were characterized by unique peasant dance ensemble, merry melodies and dance rhythms peculiar to Korea.

articles.title: Koreans Called upon to Celebrate Day of Liberation as Day of Reunification
articles.content:
Koreans Called upon to Celebrate Day of Liberation as Day of Reunification
    Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Yun Ki Jin, chairman of the South Headquarters of the National Alliance of Youth and Students for the Country's Reunification, reportedly issued on August 2 an appeal titled "Let's celebrate the August 15 liberation as August 15 reunification and independence through actions spearheaded by the youth and students".
 The appeal stressed the need for the forthcoming August 15 grand national festival to give further momentum to the strong desire for national cooperation and reunification expressed at the June 15 grand festival for national reunification held in Pyongyang.
 All the fellow countrymen are turning out to settle accounts with the United States, now that the independent force of the nation is growing stronger, the appeal said, stressing that the youth and students should be fully ready to wage a resolute anti-U.S. struggle to make this year the year of independence and reunification.    
 It underscored the need for the youth and students to play a vanguard role in the efforts to reinforce the will of all the people to wage an anti-U.S., anti-war struggle for getting the U.S. forces withdrawn from south Korea.

Greetings to President of Cote d'Ivoire
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Cote d'Ivoire
    Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, today cabled a message of greetings to Laurent Gbagbo, president of Cote d'Ivoire, on the occasion of the 45th anniversary of its independence.
 Hoping that the friendly ties existing between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms in the future, too, Kim in the message sincerely wished the president and the people of Cote d'Ivoire success in their work for the stability of the country and the national unity.
